review: Although slightly miffed none of the images or commericial show the USB power tether that connects to the actual player, the player works very well. So far I have only connected my laptop to watch CBS shows, and they come through with little delay or other problems.  Set up is pretty slick. Plug in the player in the HDMI port, then plug in the connect USB to a power source, and the device automatically starts up, showing a code and a URL link to enter on your laptop or other device. Just go to that URL, enter the code, download the app and it adds a little icon in the right corner of your brower. Click it and you are connected.  Pretty easy. Obviously you need a subscription to Hulu plus / Netflix subscription to take full advantage of the player

review: I plugged the device to one of the HDMI Input socket of my Samsung Led TV and set it up according to the given instructions. It connected to my home network and I can see Chromecast on the TV Screen. The screen covered with a photo and it changes after awhile with a different photo. It says in the instructions that you have to use your smartphone or your laptop to download the Google TV Application which is called "Chromecast Apps". I did it first with my Iphone 5s and during the connection process to the Chromecast on the TV it said "Sorry we do not support this device yet". I tried it secondly with a LG Android Phone, this time it did not connect also saying "No Chromecast device is found to be connected". I tried this operation several times changing the HDMI ports etc. After the continuous failures I decided to try my son's Macbook Pro to download the Chromecast Apps and to connect to the TV but the same result. It says "No Chromecast device is found to be connected".I am trying to reach to the relevant section of Google for some help, sending feedback but not a single help yet. Probably I will return this Item to Amazon after some more tries!

review: Works flawlessly! Using my galaxy s4 and the Netflix app i can stream 1080p to my flat-screen without any interrupts. All the apps work great with no audio/video sync issues.  Local/ downloaded content was tricky but i found a few ways that currently work pretty well! Using the avia app on galaxy s4 + windows media center you can stream any supported format like .mp4 or .avi to the chrome cast with no issues just like with netflix!  Now for unsupported formats you need Google chrome browser + an extension called Google cast. It lets you mirror anything inside your browser tab onto the chrome cast! Knowing this, with the browser open hit ctrl+o to open almost any file(EVEN .MKV!!!) into the browser an play it! (subtitles work!!! yayayay anime!!) It will then be mirrored over to your tv an it can send sound too not just video! This is slightly lower quality at 720p by default an it can vary depending on your network speed, but you can always lower the quality to 480p in the settings of the Google cast extension to make it all run smooth. I experienced a ever so slight (like .1 sec) audio/video sync issue with this method so stick to the other if you can.  This is great for media junkies like myself who just want to watch their anime/tv shows on the big screen while gaming or browsing the internet!Any questions/setup issues id be glad to help just send me a email at kotasflame@gmail.com
